EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5).

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research.
• Electricity Groups at (x=3.5, y=22.5) and (x=-4.5, y=17.5).
• Steam Engines positioned at:
  – (x=-13.5, y=16.5)
  – (x=-14.5, y=13.5)
  – (x=7.5, y=35.5)
  – (x=8.5, y=20.5)
• Boiler Module:
  – Newly placed Boiler at (x=12.0, y=20.5) intended for fluid production.
  – PipeGroup connection (fluid_system=158818, centered near (x=8.5, y=17.5)) linking the Boiler to the Steam Engine at (x=8.5, y=20.5).
   (Note: Connectivity warnings persist regarding liquid input and power network linkage.)

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) reconfigured for iron gear-wheel production (status: NO_POWER).
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5).
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5).
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5).
• Newly added Small Electric Pole at (x=5.5, y=19.5) placed to provide an attempted power connection to the Assembling Machine.

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter with pickup/drop positions centered around (x≈–3.5, y≈23.5).
• Buffer and Chest arrangements for copper ore handling.

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5).
• Depot Burner Inserter managing pick‐up and drop positions.

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of:
• Extraction source (Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5)).
• Extraction Inserter at (x=4.5, y=15.5) feeding into a manual Transport Belt Chain.
• New Target Inserter at (x=8.5, y=9.5) guiding the belt chain.

### Remote Fluid Integration System at remote region (approximate center: x=-30, y=40)
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump at (x=-30.5, y=37.5) (WORKING).
• Boiler for fluid heating at (x=-29.0, y=33.5).
• PipeGroup connection carrying water (status: FULL_OUTPUT) with segmented connection remnants.

### Expanded Smelting Zone
Consists of:
• Stone Furnaces placed at (x=-20.0, y=22.0), (x=-20.0, y=25.0), and (x=-17.0, y=25.0).
• One intended furnace at (x=-17.0, y=22.0) that could not be placed due to a blocking PipeGroup at (x=-17.5, y=21.5).
• Successfully placed Stone Furnace at (x=0.0, y=26.0) dedicated to copper smelting.

### New Network Structures
Consists of:
• Long-distance Transport Belt Network spanning from (x=-3.5, y=10.5) to (x=22.5, y=10.5) (29 belts) for interzone material transfer.
• Copper Ore Transport Line (region x≈8–9, y≈11–15) comprising 6 belts carrying copper ore.
• Integrated Auxiliary Transport Network centered at (x≈3, y≈16) with connected Belt Groups (23 belts and 16 belts) for localized production supply.
• Short Belt Connector A (approximate location x≈-0.5 to -1.5, y≈20.5) linking adjacent factory sections via 2 belts.
• Short Belt Connector B (around x≈-4.5 to -5.5) enhancing local connectivity via 2 belts plus additional segments.

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Inventory and Crafting Validation:
 – Always confirm the necessary items are in inventory before initiating placement (e.g. missing small electric pole inventory led to placement failure).
 – Ensure sub-ingredients are available when crafting complex items such as small electric poles (dependent on copper cables, which in turn require copper plates) and boilers (requiring pipes and iron plates).

• Placement and Spacing Considerations:
 – Verify that the target location is free from obstructions; repeated placement errors (e.g. electric pole placement adjacent to an occupied transport belt at (x=4.5, y=19.5)) require adjusting spacing or direction.
 – Confirm the buildable area of a structure before moving, as error messages about occupied tiles indicate potential conflicts with nearby entities.

• Pipe Connection and Resource Management:
 – Check and secure sufficient pipe resources prior to connecting fluid systems; an error stating “not enough pipe” (required 9, available 0) demonstrates the need for proactive resource management.
 – Validate that function arguments refer to valid entities (avoid passing None) when interacting with fuel insertion routines.

• Power Network and Operational Readiness:
 – Ensure that critical processing units (e.g. the Assembling Machine in the Copper Cable Factory) are both connected to the power network and supplied with necessary resources to avoid operational warnings.
 – Monitor fuel and input levels for boilers, steam engines, and related components to prevent interruptions in fluid and power supply.

• General Checks:
 – Before executing build or connection operations, review both spatial constraints and resource inventories to reduce repetitive errors involving placement, crafting dependencies, and connectivity between modules.
